text: for weeks we've been hearing about the
political debate in Washington over the
nation's debt limit but before this many
Americans may never have known that our
nation had a borrowing limit Congress
introduced it in 1917 to address some
concerns over the nation's borrowing to
pay for World War one
before that Congress had to vote on
exactly how much it would spend and what
it would spend it on each time when they
introduced the debt limit congress also
gave the Treasury Department more
freedom on how it's spent borrowed money
and they expanded that free rein in the
1930s but will greatly you use the
mortgage distress but the debt limit has
not exactly rained the country in
because since then Congress has
increased it 102 times and in the last
decade it's been raised 10 times just
back in 2002 it was six point four
trillion dollars now it's fourteen point
three trillion and they're debating
raising it a lot higher potentially up
to 16 trillion you might wonder as we
increase this debt limit up and up and
up who is so willing to loan money to
the United States well one big party is
China I want to will welcome the
president of China to our ranch it's
amazing if you think about where they
were just in 2001 China only owned about
79 billion dollars of us treasuries back
then and just in the last few years
they've gone over one trillion dollars
the positive side of having countries
like China that lend us all this money
is that it keeps interest rates low
across the entire US economy if the
country can borrow at a cheap rate it
means that companies pay less to borrow
and our credit card and mortgage
interest rates are lower so hardly
realizing it they come into their
purchasing stage
and are off on a wild non-stop right but
the negative side as the United States
debt has grown is that the interest
payments we have to pay each year to all
these lenders has grown a lot too now
we're paying about one hundred and
eighty eight billion dollars in interest
every year that's nearly equal to how
much the federal government spends on
education agriculture Housing and Urban
Development and transportation combined
one way to think about the financial
situation of the United States is to
think of your own finances if a credit
card company loans you a bunch of money
and then you miss a payment they are
going to Jack your interest rate up
right now the United States enjoys
interest rates far below other countries
particularly other countries that have
debt problems the United States pays
only three percent interest on 10-year
bonds Greece pays far more close to
twenty percent interest on its bonds
even Italy pays five percent and so
what's been at risk here as Congress
debates the debt and the debt limit is
that international investors and buyers
of Treasuries will say to the United
States we want more interest just like
your credit card company would say to
you if you missed a payment there are no
easy answers though because we're still
in a very weak economy and it might be
hard right now to wean off of all this
borrowing that we've gotten used to
you
